website_summaries.verdict: The overall feedback for the Terrex Two Parley has been positive. This Adidas trail running shoe is praised for its eye-catching looks, the lightweight construction, and the exceptional traction. The use of recycled plastic-based yarns for the upper is also commended. On the other hand, the thin instep construction and the flimsy heel security have become the points of criticism.Fans of neutral running shoes that are for the trails are the target market of the Adidas Terrex Two Parley.
pros: Several people claim that the forefoot section of the Adidas Terrex Two Parley is wide enough to welcome natural toe-splay
A handful of consumers have noticed that the fabrics of the upper unit are smooth enough to prevent irritation
The outsole unit of this trail running shoe is praised for having a grippy construction that adheres properly to the ground
The aesthetics have been lauded by those who desire a trail companion that is appealing to the eyes
Runners are happy with the environment-friendliness of the Parley Ocean Plastic™ yarns that are used for the upper unit
The midsole unit is deemed sufficiently light and reactive for daily use
cons: Some users complain of pressure points near the instep, a phenomenon that is attributed to the thin fabric and its lack of padding
The rear portion of the facade is wrinkly and not very secure, according to a few testers

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, tight, breathable, grippy.
customer_reviews.text: I finally found a replacement for my Nike FSB chukka. the laces seem like they are more for looks as I feel I don't actually need them, maybe as the shoe ages they will come in handy. The material that make the 'sock' of the shoe is very firm but also flexible. The heel has a little bit of protection and feels firm and hugs the heel in place. The toe bed is nice and wide so as I hike, run, walk all day there is plenty of breathing room for those little swells that happen. Also, recycled ocean plastic... bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Vynsie

customer_reviews.title: Light and great for trail runs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shoe for my son. He loves the fit - they’re light and the soft snug fit up-to his ankle is great. He’s only had them two weeks but says his runs are much more enjoyable and he loves the spring-feel from the shoes
customer_reviews.author: Atticus

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: My son wore them once on the trail and could hardly walk they hurt his feet so bad . I couldn't return them as my fault I didn't read that it said if even wore once they were non returnable . So from now on I will but his shoes direct from Adidas .
customer_reviews.author: Lyndie

customer_reviews.title: Love This Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Have this shoe in 2 colors. Absolutely love the sole's grip and how light the shoe is. One of the most comfortable shoes I've owned. Wore for 10+ hours at Disney World with no rubbing or pinching. Wear them camping, hiking, to the gym, or just around to run errands in. Any time I can wear athletic shoes, these are my 1st choice. I have a thinner foot, so they aren't hard to get on like others have stated. Plenty of support in the arch. I don't think the sole will ever wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Philip S.

customer_reviews.title: Shoes Won’t Fit Right
customer_reviews.text: Shoe fits too tight around the ankle and elastic doesn’t give enough for comfort. Seller, Essential Trends, won’t refund either.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Huston

customer_reviews.title: Expectations met at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I needed and outdoor running shoe- but not at a price that would make my stomach turn! (There is something obscene about paying upwards of 200 dollars for running shoes that are going to take a beating outdoors.) These get the job done more than adequately, and at a third of the cost of other models. Adidas quality for sure. All that and environmentally conscious? No brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Berger

customer_reviews.title: Smells and cushioned
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits tightly around the foot, which makes no room for the foot to breath this makes your feet smell after you remove the shoe (my feet never smell). It is comfortable and nicely cushioned. One more thing the flap around your ankle take around 1 week of wearing to get break in it.
customer_reviews.author: RZ

customer_reviews.title: Truly prime service.
customer_reviews.text: Great service. Delivery was spot on. Sneakers are what I was looking for. 🙌🏽🙌🏽🙌🏽💪🏽💪🏽🙏🏽
customer_reviews.author: Arnoldinho25

customer_reviews.title: Too tight and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Shoes were nice but overall fit was really bad too tight around the ankel they didn't fit comfortable at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Overall great shoe. The tab in the back rubs A bit more than it should and is uncomfortable in the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: sugarwooffer

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable at all
customer_reviews.text: Rub against the foot back angle and pad, feeling unwell.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Ng

customer_reviews.title: no 1
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very comfortable and also very beautiful and high quality
customer_reviews.author: ronen

product_meta.title: adidas Ef4814, Men’s Terrex Two Parley
product_meta.description: adidas Outdoor Terrex Two Parley, Black/Grey Two/Linen Green, 7.5
feature_bullets: Go all out in all weather
